question.text: Which of the following will not occur during conversion of a secondary follicle into tertiary follicle?

solution.text:
Folliculargenesis (development of ovarian follicles) -

I. Primary follicles are converted to secondary follicles by getting surrounded by a few more layers of granulosa cells and a new theca.

II. The following changes occur in the secondary follicle after which it is immediately converted to a tertiary follicle:

A. Development of a fluid-filled cavity called - Antrum.

B. Differentiation of theca layer into - Theca interna (inner) and theca externa (outer).

C. Primary oocyte grows in size, completes meiosis-I (unequal division) resulting in the formation of a large haploid secondary oocyte and a small first polar body.

III. Tertiary follicle changes into the mature follicle (or Graafian follicle).
